intro: Taraxacum paralium, commonly known as the alpine dandelion, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Europe and is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow composite flowers. The plant produces a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by the wind. It thrives in rocky and alpine environments, often growing at high elevations. Taraxacum paralium is adapted to cold climates and is often found in meadows and grasslands at altitudes above 1,500 meters.
